comment.shortText: Should the URI be triple slashed `scheme:///path` or double slashed `scheme://path`.
An object of parameters that will be converted into a query string.
URI protocol `<scheme>://` that must be built into your native app.
The path into the app specified by the URL.
The set of query parameters specified by the query string of the url used to open the app.

Add a handler to `Linking` changes by listening to the `url` event type and providing the handler.
It is recommended to use the [`useURL()`](#useurl) hook instead.
comment.returns: An EmitterSubscription that has the remove method from EventSubscription

comment.shortText: The only valid type is `'url'`.

An [`URLListener`](#urllistener) function that takes an `event` object of the type
[`EventType`](#eventype).

Determine whether or not an installed app can handle a given URL.
On web this always returns `true` because there is no API for detecting what URLs can be opened.
comment.returns:
A `Promise` object that is fulfilled with `true` if the URL can be handled, otherwise it
`false` if not.

The `Promise` will reject on Android if it was impossible to check if the URL can be opened, and
on iOS if you didn't [add the specific scheme in the `LSApplicationQueriesSchemes` key inside **Info.plist**](/guides/linking#linking-from-your-app).

comment.shortText: The URL that you want to test can be opened.
Collect a list of platform schemes from the manifest.
comment.text:
This method is based on the `Scheme` modules from `@expo/config-plugins`
which are used for collecting the schemes before prebuilding a native app.

- iOS: scheme -> ios.scheme -> ios.bundleIdentifier
- Android: scheme -> android.scheme -> android.package

comment.shortText:
Helper method for constructing a deep link into your app, given an optional path and set of query
parameters. Creates a URI scheme with two slashes by default.
comment.text:
The scheme in bare and standalone must be defined in the Expo config (`app.config.js` or `app.json`)
under `expo.scheme`.

# Examples
- Bare: `<scheme>://path` - uses provided scheme or scheme from Expo config `scheme`.
- Standalone, Custom: `yourscheme://path`
- Web (dev): `https://localhost:19006/path`
- Web (prod): `https://myapp.com/path`
- Expo Client (dev): `exp://128.0.0.1:19000/--/path`
- Expo Client (prod): `exp://exp.host/@yourname/your-app/--/path`
comment.returns: A URL string which points to your app with the given deep link information.

comment.shortText: Addition path components to append to the base URL.
Additional options object.
Get the URL that was used to launch the app if it was launched by a link.
comment.returns: The URL string that launched your app, or `null`.

comment.shortText: Ensure the user has linked the expo-constants manifest in bare workflow.

Create a URL that works for the environment the app is currently running in.
The scheme in bare and standalone must be defined in the app.json under `expo.scheme`.
comment.text:
# Examples
- Bare: empty string
- Standalone, Custom: `yourscheme:///path`
- Web (dev): `https://localhost:19006/path`
- Web (prod): `https://myapp.com/path`
- Expo Client (dev): `exp://128.0.0.1:19000/--/path`
- Expo Client (prod): `exp://exp.host/@yourname/your-app/--/path`
comment.returns: A URL string which points to your app with the given deep link information.

tags.text:
An alias for [`createURL()`](#linkingcreateurlpath-namedparameters). This method is
deprecated and will be removed in a future SDK version.

comment.shortText: addition path components to append to the base URL.

An object with a set of query parameters. These will be merged with any
Expo-specific parameters that are needed (e.g. release channel) and then appended to the URL
as a query string.

Optional URI protocol to use in the URL `<scheme>:///`, when `undefined` the scheme
will be chosen from the Expo config (`app.config.js` or `app.json`).
Open the operating system settings app and displays the appâ€™s custom settings, if it has any.

Attempt to open the given URL with an installed app. See the [Linking guide](/guides/linking)
for more information.
comment.returns:
A `Promise` that is fulfilled with `true` if the link is opened operating system
automatically or the user confirms the prompt to open the link. The `Promise` rejects if there
are no applications registered for the URL or the user cancels the dialog.

comment.shortText: A URL for the operating system to open, eg: `tel:5555555`, `exp://`.
Helper method for parsing out deep link information from a URL.
A URL that points to the currently running experience (e.g. an output of `Linking.createURL()`).

Helper method which wraps React Native's `Linking.getInitialURL()` in `Linking.parse()`.
Parses the deep link information out of the URL used to open the experience initially.
If no link opened the app, all the fields will be `null`.
> On the web it parses the current window URL.
comment.returns: A promise that resolves with `ParsedURL` object.

comment.shortText: Remove a handler by passing the `url` event type and the handler.

tags.text: Call `remove()` on the return value of `addEventListener()` instead.

comment.shortText: The only valid type is `'url'`.

An [`URLListener`](#urllistener) function that takes an `event` object of the type
[`EventType`](#eventype).

Launch an Android intent with extras.
> Use [IntentLauncher](./intent-launcher) instead, `sendIntent` is only included in
> `Linking` for API compatibility with React Native's Linking API.
Returns the initial URL followed by any subsequent changes to the URL.
